meanings.definition: The act of extinguishing or putting out a fire or light.
meanings.sent1: Firefighters quickly responded to the extinguishments of the house fire.
meanings.sent2: The extinguishments of the candles left the room in darkness.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden extinguishments of all the torches.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the extinguishments of a thousand tiny flames.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the extinguishments echoed through the quiet night.

meanings.definition: The state of being extinguished or put out.
meanings.sent1: The complete extinguishments of the fire left only ashes behind.
meanings.sent2: The extinguishments of the streetlights made the road dark and eerie.
meanings.sent3: The sudden extinguishments of the campfire startled everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The extinguishments of hope in his eyes were evident to all who saw him.
meanings.sent5: The extinguishments of the stars signaled the arrival of dawn.
